Text:
The Miami Heat defeated the Oklahoma City Thunder 121-106 Thursday in Game 5 of the NBA Finals to capture the 2011-12 championship.

The Heat won the best-of-seven series 4-1, winning four straight after losing Game 1 in Oklahoma City. LeBron James had a triple double with 26 points, 13 assists and 11 rebounds in a Finals-MVP winning performance. Chris Bosh scored 24 points and Dwyane Wade added 20 and eight rebounds, while Mike Miller hit seven 3's and scored a postseason-high 23 points off the bench.

It was the second championship in Heat franchise history. They won the first in 2005-06.

The Heat led most of the way, last trailing with 7:43 remaining in the first quarter. Miami led 59-49 at halftime, but took control early in the second half. The Heat outscored Oklahoma City by 14 in the third quarter, leading by as many as 26.

The Thunder were led by Kevin Durant's 32 points. Russell Westbrook, the team's second-leading scorer, finished with 19 points on 4 of 20 shooting
